Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 42nd overall pick, by St. Louis in 1969...
Drafted in 3rd round, 42nd overall pick, by St. Louis in 1969...
Traded from St. Louis to Minnesota on 6/25/1969 (Going to STL: C E. Battey, SS T. Reynolds, 2B B. Allen, RF W. Horton. Going to MIN: 1B S. Garvey, 3B M. Rogodzinski)...
Injured on 8/6/1969 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Injured on 6/17/1970 with a Bruised Hand, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 4/7/1972, off Masanori Murakami (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/12/1972, off Ron Reed (OAK)...
Won Batter of the Month award on 5/1/1975, hitting .386 with 6 HR, 19 RBI...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 8 RBI against Cleveland on 9/4/1975...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1977...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Oakland on 6/13/1978...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1978, hitting .571 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Boston on 7/13/1978...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1978...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
